title: How to Make a Butterfly Out of Ribbon

steps.headline: Cut two pieces of 8.5 ribbon and two pieces of 6.5 ribbon (including grosgrain ribbon and organza ribbon).
steps.description:
Wrap a hair clip with ribbon. Take out an 8.5 grosgrain ribbon; fold it in half; find out the center of ribbon by pinching it in the middle; glue the center of ribbon with hot melt gun; stick it onto the clip. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b4\/Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b4\/Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Bring the ends of the ribbon; loop them around and glue them down.
Do the same to glue a 6 grosgrain ribbon to clip.
Make the bottom half of your butterfly by looping the ends of 6.5 ribbon and glue them up.
Lay the 8.5 organza ribbon over the top half of the butterfly; loop around the ends and glue them down.
Do the same to the other 6.5 organza ribbon below.
steps.description: Then wings of butterfly all have been done.

steps.headline: Time needs spending on body making.
steps.description:
Wrap two pieces of 6 ribbon around a pencil; fix the ends of ribbon with wooden clip. It is better to bake it at 275 degrees for 20-25 minutes. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8f\/Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-7.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8f\/Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-7.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Cut the bodies to the right size and glue them down the middle.
Cut out 1 ribbon; cut the edges off from the ribbon.
steps.description: Hold the edges over a flame to make them curl up that will be used as antennas.

steps.headline: Glue the two antennas onto the top of your clip.
steps.description: A great-looking butterfly hair clip is formed.

text:
Cut two pieces of 8.5 ribbon and two pieces of 6.5 ribbon (including grosgrain ribbon and organza ribbon). Wrap a hair clip with ribbon. Take out an 8.5 grosgrain ribbon; fold it in half; find out the center of ribbon by pinching it in the middle; glue the center of ribbon with hot melt gun; stick it onto the clip. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Bring the ends of the ribbon; loop them around and glue them down. Do the same to glue a 6 grosgrain ribbon to clip. Make the bottom half of your butterfly by looping the ends of 6.5 ribbon and glue them up. Lay the 8.5 organza ribbon over the top half of the butterfly; loop around the ends and glue them down. Do the same to the other 6.5 organza ribbon below. Then wings of butterfly all have been done. Time needs spending on body making. Wrap two pieces of 6 ribbon around a pencil; fix the ends of ribbon with wooden clip. It is better to bake it at 275 degrees for 20-25 minutes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-7.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-7.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Butterfly-Out-of-Ribbon-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut the bodies to the right size and glue them down the middle. Cut out 1 ribbon; cut the edges off from the ribbon. Hold the edges over a flame to make them curl up that will be used as antennas. Glue the two antennas onto the top of your clip. A great-looking butterfly hair clip is formed.
